title: Ireland vow to make an impact on World Cup after restorative break
text:
Simon Easterby believes Ireland are going to make the doubters eat their words, saying he is confident they can still “make a mark” on this World Cup.

Having started with a comprehensive 27-3 victory over Scotland, hopes were high that Ireland had put their stuttering 2019 form behind them. But defeat by Japan followed by a stodgy win over Russia has raised alarm bells, with critics focusing on Ireland’s one-dimensional play

Easterby, though, believes the form which made Ireland arguably the world’s best team 12 months ago is still in there. And he is expecting a big performance from his men against Samoa on Saturday to give the team momentum heading into the quarter-finals.

"This week feels...
description: Simon Easterby believes Ireland are going to make the doubters eat their words, saying he is confident they can still “make a mark” on this World Cup.
